FuncDef: The interface range command creates a temporary interface group and adds specified interfaces to this temporary interface group. Commands configured for a temporary interface group then automatically run on all member interfaces. The interface range command creates a temporary interface group and adds specified interfaces to this temporary interface group. Commands configured for a temporary interface group then automatically run on all member interfaces. By default, no temporary interface group is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type of a start interface.
-

Specifies the number of a start interface.
-

Specifies the type of an end interface.
-

Specifies the number of an end interface.
-

ExtraInfo: Typically, the device has a large number of ports and has the same configuration under many ports. At this point, configuring these interfaces on a case-by-case basis can be cumbersome and prone to input errors. Therefore, the interface that will need to execute the same configuration command, defined as a port group, will automatically execute these command lines under all member interfaces bound by the port group when the port group is configured.
